name: The Spellbringing... The Spellslashing... The spellslinging Singer!!!
author: Rienion

posts.author: Rienion
posts.content:
Yo, I recently came up with an idea. An idea that is ideally ideaish that it's just crazy enough to get us all blown up.

Recently I was on Arelith.... takin on a lich... and something came to me. Why am I fighting a lich? Why can't I be a lich? (Also kinda freaking out from the voices playing over a bit.)

I thought to myself... is a Sorcerer/Bard possible? I mean... they both used Charisma as their main stat. If anything that's some synergy.

I figured I'd come here to seek help.

Arelith
Server Cap 30
Weapon of Choice: ...Whistling?
Race; Halfing, Elf, Human... (Yeah, go on.. laugh) har har har

I couldn't think of a fully eveloped synergy, but I thought about the beginning classes to start off as sorcerer.
Reason?
The sorcerer gets some perks, however, since I want  to attempt the bard (as part of a buffer/singer) thing I dunno how well it would work out. Sorcerers get a perk. Two in fact. I want to use one of them, but I'm not sure which one would 'affect' the bard side of things. So, I'l; post them here.

The Path of the True Flame can be chosen at character creation by sorcerers. Followers of the Path of the True Flame get unlimited spells per day, but can cast only evocation spells. This limitation includes spells cast from scrolls, wands, and items like potions; Mundane items, however, are the exception to the rule. Epic spells must also only be Evocation (this means Greater ruin and Hellball) however they can only be cast once per rest as per normal.


Weave Master can be chosen at character creation by sorcerers. Weave masters get unlimited spells per day, but they trigger a cooldown period whenever they cast a spell above the first circle in which they cannot cast any spell. The Cooldown formula is: (Spell level -1)*6 seconds.Note that while the cooldown is still in effect, Weave Masters may still cast spells from other sources, like wands, scrolls and potions.The cooldown timer is based on the spell slot, and not the actual spell itself. So spells modified with metamagic, except Quicken Spell, will increase the cooldown accordingly.
  • The metamagic Feat "Quicken Spell", when used to cast a spell, will reduce the effective level of the spell by 1 when calculating cooldowns.
  • Using Quicken Spell once you have autoquicken will not decrease the cooldown further.
  • Auto Quicken I: Spells of level 2-3 no longer have cooldown.
  • Auto Quicken II: Spells of level 4-6 count as 2 levels lower, for the purpose of cooldown.
  • Auto Quicken III: Spells of level 7-9 count as 3 levels lower, for the purpose of cooldown.
(Empower and Maximize double and triple cooldowns respectively)

Do you guys have any ideas? (Whether true flame or Weave mastery is useable is up to debate, as you guys are the experts. But, not running out of spells every 5 seconds does help. (I can ask the Lich that personally)

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Lichs are of the undead race.  If that's what you really are trying to mimic or roleplay, your closest choices are Palemaster or Risen Lord. 

A singing Lich is sort of... ummm... a product of the Twilight Zone or Poltergeist rather than Forgotten Realms.

The problem in going with a dual-caster split is the same today as it ever has been... buffs easy to dispel and pathetic spell penetration.  Besides, without pally or BG shoved in there your saves will be just as awful without the true synergy.  Two casting classes that share the same prime casting ability is not a synergy.  A synergy means two unrelated features boosting each other like a cleric's prime casting ability synergizing with Monk's WIS AC.  Same deal with a druid/cleric.  Dilutes the casting potential of a single class at the expense of spell diversity and displays no synergy.

It's not a new idea.  I seem to recall a couple attempts to reinvent this wheel back in 2006-ish. Those ideas got appropriately tossed into the heap of "nice-try-but-back-to-the-drawing-board" builds for posterity to avoid.

Beyond the 3-consecutive-class rule I know little of all the customizations on Arelith.  But there are plenty, including subraces IIRC.  Sry.  Not much help here.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: A Bard 24 / Fighter 6 could be pretty good. The problem is that if DEX-based, you would lose your DEX AC if caught flat-footed without Uncanny Dodge, and if STR-based, your AC would suffer, and/or you would wind up wearing heavy armor, which makes casting harder.

posts.content:
This is the about the best I can do trying to grasp your intent.  Your basic singing spellsword. The plain WF: Greatsword is delayed into epic because it's too feat-starved and needs BG for martial weapons.  If you are willing to settle for bard weapons, you could dump one of the metamagic feats and take WF in that slot and then either Armor Skin or Epic Prowess in the vacated epic feat slot.  Your Divine shield will be at +7 (+10 w/empowered eagle).  Same deal for Divine Might and saves. +10.  BTW, I intentionally made an exalted sorc design so you could compare these awesome saves with a non-synergized sorc.  If you can reach the CHA cap with a combo of buffs and gear, the enchancements will reach +13 (CHA 36).  You'll be needed to taunt to raise that AB into the effective hit zone, however.

It does a little minor singing and Level 2 bard spells but gets EMA (eventually) so you can use either plate or robes with the duration of almost a full day and indispellable (and uninterruptable). The sorc buffs should stick fairly well with 21 levels.  Not so for the bard ones, however.  TBH, bard is mostly there for skill dumps.  If you can use it, swell.  If not, keep it for comparisons.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Then they did change the rules on your server.  The Spellcraft qualifiers are supposed to be allocated ranks, not modified ones.  You'll need to disclose stuff like this upfront if you seek an informed recommendation.

Rogue skills?  Why not just cross-class them?  That's what I do for most of my non-rogue/non-assassin builds.  If you are planning on a typical stealth build, you are going to need to focus on DEX which will boost your lock-picking and trapsetting anyway.   Disabling traps is not difficult with Take20 but recovering them can be.  With enough Perform and Bard levels, you'll get enough of a skill boost to handle just about all the rogue-type skills you want.  All you need to know about traps can be found here.

TBH, I've lost track of where you seem to be headed with this request.  It seems a lot like just a string of random ideas to me.  But I am starting to fade so may not be perceiving something that should be more obvious.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
You won't gain any notable benefit from adding rogue unless it's a DEX build.  In that case, you'll need Weapon Finesse and be limited to finessable weapons.  3 levels of rogue nets you Evasion and, more importantly, Uncanny Dodge with the possibility of Epic Dodge ever-looming with high enough DEX.  Epic Dodge will come in very late if you strive to get it within 30 levels (Tumble 30, DEX 25, Rog 13).

If going the STR route to broaden your weapon choices and combat feats (like Power Attack, Cleave and so on), rogue levels are more of a liability than a boon.  You won't need Uncanny Dodge, the chances of Evasion having much value is significantly reduced due to your pedestrian (non-DEX-focused) reflexes and the chances of an XP penalty trying to balance 3 non-prestige class levels is ever-present.  As stated before, if you want rogue skills, just take them.  Any class can diversify into traps, locks and detection by cross-classing and bard's skill boost by singing song 6+ increases those talents better than most non-rogue/non-assassin's can.

As far as how many fighter levels, that depends on what you desire to achieve.  Lots of them if you want to dual-wield and get a boost to damage.  The minimum if you just need access to heavy armor, shields and martial weapons.  And that all depends on whether its focused on DEX or STR.  So that's your first decision.  The next will be how strong you want to focus on party-buffing.  You need at least Bard 20 and Perform 25 for Lasting Inspiration.  Decisions, decisions.  We can't help you with that part, just lay out the choices for you.
